text:
Lady Gaga slams body-shamers after being criticised for her weight during Super Bowl performance 
The pop superstar has said that she won't 'cater to anyone' Wednesday 8 February 2017 10:17 GMT Click to followES Entertainment 'Proud': Lady Gaga has slammed body-shamers after the Super Bowl Larry W.Smith/EPA 
Lady Gaga has hit back at body-shamers following her performance at the Super Bowl Halftime show, saying that she is ‘proud’ of the way she looks. 
Responding to criticism on Twitter about her figure and skimpy outfit, the pop superstar has said that she doesn’t need to ‘cater to anyone’. 
In a lengthy Instagram post following the show, Gaga wrote: “I heard my body is a topic of conversation so I wanted to say, I'm proud of my body and you should be proud of yours too. 
“No matter who you are or what you do. I could give you a million reasons why you don't need to cater to anyone or anything to succeed. A photo posted by xoxo, Joanne (@ladygaga) on Feb 7, 2017 at 8:38pm PST 

“Be you, and be relentlessly you. That's the stuff of champions. thank you so much everyone for supporting me. I love you guys. Xoxo, gaga.” 
While the vast majority of people showered the star with praise following her show-stopping performance, some Twitter-users felt the need to comment about her weight. Lady Gaga wows audience at Super Bowl half-time show 
“Just feel like #Gaga's dough should've been tucked in better,” one person wrote on the social media site. 
“You guys didn't tell me Gaga had a beer belly,” someone else posted. Read more
